item.title: House Can't Respond to World Crises as GOP Speaker Fight Rages On
item.description: With a new war in the Mideast, a continuing one in Europe and government funding due to expire soon, Republicans bickered with no end in sight.

item.title: A Soft Landing in the U.S. Could Be Hard for Everyone Else
item.description: Conflict in the Middle East, surging global interest rates and elevated oil prices threaten a fragile recovery.

item.title: Exxon CEO's $60 Billion Vindication
item.description: Darren Woods didn’t waver in his full-throttled belief in oil. Now his one-time doubters back his $60 billion deal for shale giant Pioneer.

item.title: The U.S. must prepare to expand its nuclear forces in the years ahead to deter the twin threats from China and Russia, a congressionally appointed commission said.
item.description: The U.S. must prepare to expand its nuclear forces in the years ahead to deter the twin threats from China and Russia, a congressionally appointed commission said.

item.title: China appeared to have repatriated a large number of North Koreans this week, despite international pressure given the harsh punishment the returnees likely face back in the Kim Jong Un regime.
item.description: China appeared to have repatriated a large number of North Koreans this week, despite international pressure given the harsh punishment the returnees likely face back in the Kim Jong Un regime.

item.title: The Kaiser Permanente health system reached a tentative agreement with unions that would raise wages and increase investment in staffing.
item.description: The Kaiser Permanente health system reached a tentative agreement with unions that would raise wages and increase investment in staffing.

item.title: Residents of Gaza were bracing for a lengthy assault by the Israeli military, which demanded a mass evacuation of some of the territory's most densely populated neighborhoods.
item.description: Residents of Gaza were bracing for a lengthy assault by the Israeli military, which demanded a mass evacuation of some of the territory’s most densely populated neighborhoods.

item.title: House Republicans chose Jim Jordan as their nominee for speaker, but it remained uncertainwhether the ally of Trumpcould avoid the fate of Steve Scalise.
item.description: House Republicans chose Jim Jordan as their nominee for speaker, but it remained uncertain whether the ally of Trump could avoid the fate of Steve Scalise.

item.title: UAW spared GM and Stellantis from a strike escalation Friday, two days after a surprise walkout at one of Ford's most profitable plants.
item.description: UAW spared GM and Stellantis from a strike escalation Friday, two days after a surprise walkout at one of Ford’s most profitable plants.

item.title: Microsoft closed its $75 billion acquisition of Activision, the biggest deal in the software company's nearly 50-year history.
item.description: Microsoft closed its $75 billion acquisition of Activision, the biggest deal in the software company’s nearly 50-year history.

item.title: The threat of broader conflict in the Middle East drove investors to safe-haven assets Friday. The tech-heavy Nasdaq and the S&P 500 shed 1.2% and 0.5%, respectively, while the Dow added 0.1%.
item.description: The threat of broader conflict in the Middle East drove investors to safe-haven assets Friday. The tech-heavy Nasdaq and the S&P 500 shed 1.2% and 0.5%, respectively, while the Dow added 0.1%.

item.title: The Hamas attack that killed at least 1,300 people in Israel has left Jewish communities around the world on edge, as Jews confront rising vitriol, threats and violence.
item.description: The Hamas attack that killed at least 1,300 people in Israel has left Jewish communities around the world on edge, as Jews confront rising vitriol, threats and violence.

item.title: Robust economic growth propelled earnings at the nation's largest banks, but their executives warned the good times may end soon.
item.description: Robust economic growth propelled earnings at the nation’s largest banks, but their executives warned the good times may end soon.

item.title: The SEC adopted rules that will give traders a broader look at which public companies are being targeted by short sellers as part of its response to the 2021 GameStop trading frenzy.
item.description: The SEC adopted rules that will give traders a broader look at which public companies are being targeted by short sellers as part of its response to the 2021 GameStop trading frenzy.

item.title: In talks between striking actors and entertainment industry giants, the union's demand for a cut of streaming services' revenue has proven to be the sticking point.
item.description: In talks between striking actors and entertainment industry giants, the union’s demand for a cut of streaming services’ revenue has proven to be the sticking point.

item.title: Died: Louise Glück, 80, American poet who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2020.
item.description: Died: Louise Glück, 80, American poet who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 2020.

item.title: The White House is injecting a gusher of cash into hydrogen production, in a bet that the undeveloped sector will aid in the shift away from fossil fuels.
item.description: The White House is injecting a gusher of cash into hydrogen production, in a bet that the undeveloped sector will aid in the shift away from fossil fuels.
